a1: CIDR notation (e.g., /24) defines the network prefix length. A /24 gives 256 IPs, /16 gives 65,536 IPs, etc.
q2: What is the maximum range I can list?
a2: The tool lists individual IPs for ranges up to /24 (256 addresses) to keep the browser responsive.
q3: What is the first and last IP?
a3: The first IP is the network address (all host bits 0) and the last IP is the broadcast address (all host bits 1).
q4: Can I copy all IPs at once?
a4: Yes, use the "Copy all" button to copy the entire IP list with one IP per line.
